body_html:
Can you explain your motivation behind freezing the model mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_frozen.pb? The model is already frozen, so you do not need to run it through the freeze_graph tool again.

Here are a few suggestions on next steps:

  1. If you are trying to use TensorFlow Lite with this model, then use the provided mobilenet_v1_1.0_224.tflite file.

  2. If you want to freeze the graph to understand how to use the tool, freeze the pbtxt file provided. You can use the following command after defining PATH_TO_MOBILNET.

blaze run third_party/tensorflow/python/tools/freeze_graph -- \
--input_graph=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_eval.pbtxt \
--input_checkpoint=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/mobilenet_v1_1.0_224.ckpt \
--output_graph=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/freezed_mobilenet.pb \
--output_node_names=MobilenetV1/Predictions/Reshape_1 \
--input_binary=false
  1. If you want to be able to use TensorFlow Lite on a graph you trained, you have the following options, a few of which don't directly use freeze graph. You can use either TocoConverter (Python API) or tflite_convert (command line tool) with your model. TocoConverter accepts a tf.Session, frozen graph file, SavedModel directory, or a tf.keras model file. tflite_convert accepts the later three formats.

body:
Can you explain your motivation behind freezing the model `mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_frozen.pb`? The model is already frozen, so you do not need to run it through the `freeze_graph` tool again.

Here are a few suggestions on next steps:
1. If you are trying to use TensorFlow Lite with this model, then use the provided `mobilenet_v1_1.0_224.tflite` file.

2. If you want to freeze the graph to understand how to use the tool, freeze the `pbtxt` file provided. You can use the following command after defining `PATH_TO_MOBILNET`.
```
blaze run third_party/tensorflow/python/tools/freeze_graph -- \
--input_graph=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_eval.pbtxt \
--input_checkpoint=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/mobilenet_v1_1.0_224.ckpt \
--output_graph=$PATH_TO_MOBILENET/freezed_mobilenet.pb \
--output_node_names=MobilenetV1/Predictions/Reshape_1 \
--input_binary=false
```

3. If you want to be able to use TensorFlow Lite on a graph you trained, you have the following options, a few of which don't directly use freeze graph. You can use either [`TocoConverter`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/toco/g3doc/python_api.md) (Python API) or [`tflite_convert`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/toco/g3doc/cmdline_examples.md) (command line tool) with your model. `TocoConverter` accepts a `tf.Session`, frozen graph file, SavedModel directory, or a `tf.keras` model file. `tflite_convert` accepts the later three formats.
